dialogues.FISHER:
[1]Yup. 
[2]Government cutbacks. 
[3]We missed the deadline.

[5]I'm not sure. 
[6]I think so.

[8]Sent it. 
[9]Sent it. 
[10]Yup. 
[11]Yes. 
[12]I think I forgot the tent. 
[13]I think so. 
[14]Why what? 
[15]I didn't mean to Liz. I'm sorry. 
[16]I'm not playing around. I forgot. 
[17]How could I know what else I forgot? 
[18]Because you wanted to. You wanted this to be your wedding not your parent's. 
[19]What? 
[20]Stop it. I'm sorry. 
[21]I'm sorry. I'm sorry I forgot the tent. I don't think I forgot anything else. 
[22]Are we going to do this again? 
[23]I wouldn't know. 
[24]They organized this, not me. I have nothing to do with it. 
[25]How do you figure? 
[26]It's a bachelor party. You sort of have to do it before the wedding. 
[27]He is. 
[28]He's my friend. He's not a moron.

[31]Who else?

[33]What does Moore have to do with your growing? 
[34]I've known him since Cub Scouts.

[36]He just doesn't talk a lot. 
[37]He's a great chef.

[39]Time out. 
[40]That's absurd.

[42]You will not be common!!! 
[43]Of course. 
[44]With all my heart. 
[45]I don't know. She's really been stressing out. 
[46]What does that mean? 
[47]About what? 
[48]I just want her to be happy.

[52]He's your brother.

[54]Problems? 
[55]Okay.

[57]What kind of seats can we have? 
[58]So what do we do? 
[59]Go down where? 
[60]Honey I don't have the time... 
[61]We're leaving in three hours. 
[62]I'll call them from the road. 
[63]More than I ever imagined being able to love anyone ever. 
[64]We're leaving from Adam's. Come send me off. 
[65]I will. 
[66]Of course. 
[67]I love you. 
[68]You said that Boyd. 
[69]
[70]Is this Pico Party rents? Can I speak to whomever is in charge of chairs? Chairs.

I'll put him in the car and take him out there. I'll take him to Maine for a big Lobster dinner, go skiing in Vermont, hot dogs at Yankee Stadium... I won't stare him down. 
[89]I won't do it. 
[90]I know and I'm honored... 
[91]I know...

[96]Oh, Jesus... call the police. 
[97]She's dead. Call somebody! 
[98]Call 911. 
[99]Fuck! Fuck you fucking guys! 
[100]What are you talking about? Adam's right. We don't have a choice here Boyd... I mean what are you talking about? What options??? 
[101]Oh for Christsake Boyd. Somebody must know she's here. 
[102]Oh God. This is insane. 
[103]I'm getting married... 
[104]Good God... Good God... 
[105]Me. 
[106]No! NOOOO!!! 
[107]I'm calling the police. 
[108]No way. 
[109]I got to agree with that. 
[110]I think we should say some words over the grave. 
[111]I'm talking about prayer. 
[112]Dear God... I don't know how to pray. 
[113]Michael, now is probably not the best time for this. 
[114]Dear God, please forgive us for what we have done here tonight. We have lost our way. Speaking for myself, let me say... 
[115]...I am deeply in love with the woman I am about to marry and I look very much forward to raising a family and being a positive member of society. We promise, if you forgive us, we will never forget this tragedy and will try with all our powers to use it as a daily reminder that we are here on earth to do good not evil. Let us go from this day forward with new purpose and spirit. You have given us a second chance and let us take that second chance and use it as fuel to feed our fires of productivity so that the spirits of the two we now bury live on forever in the good deeds and positive achievements we from this moment on shall make our life's work... 
[116]Thank you lord, and again, we ask for your forgiveness and guidance... Amen. 
[117]Hey. It's me. 
[118]We're on our way home. I just... we're running a little late. 
[119]No. Just like an hour or so. 
[120]Okay. 
[121]What! 
[122]I left a message. I think it's going to be okay. 
[123]No. No. I'll see you in about four hours. 
[124]What. 
[125]I don't think so. 
[126]The first day. 
[127]It goes; "Today is the first day of the rest of our lives." 
[128]I'm working on it. 
[129]Yea... It's great... seems like... I don't know you've got all the important stuff in there. 
[130]Are we supposed to? 
[131]"Darli...ing you, ewe ewe ewe, send me, Darli...ing you, ewe ewe ewe, mend me. 
[132]You did all right dad. 
[133]You never walked away dad. You could have walked away. 
[134]Harry Chaplin. "Cats in the Cradle." 
[135]I love you dad. 
[136]Where did you get that? 
[137]This is our honeymoon. 
[138]How much? 
[139]Jesus Adam, can we not get into this now please? 
[140]I got you. 
[141]You always were a jealous man. 
[142]No, the problem, as I recall, was the lack of blocking... 
[143]You all right? 
[144]Shut up Boyd. 
[145]He's having a problem here. 
[146]Shut up. 
[147]Yeah baby. Everything's great. 
[148]Yeah. Sure. 
[149]Yeah. Look honey, I'll be right in. I just... we're just taking care of some Groomsmen last minute business.

[151]OK, OK. You guys just go back in. Dad, keep going with the toast, we'll be right in. Go on. 
[152]Shut up! 
[153]Everything's OK. Just some more preparations. 
[154]No baby. We'll all be right in. 
[155]No. Nothing like that. 
[156]Easy Boyd. 
[157]Thank you. 
[158]He's cracked up. 
[159]Boyd... What have we done? 
[160]What? 
[161]I said, what have we done? 
[162]I don't know! I just want to get married. 
[163]What? 
[164]I just want to get married.

[167]Can we just talk this out? 
[168]Hello? 
[169]...burying them outside of Vegas, about Boyd being the ring leader... She wants to know what the hell is going on and I'm starting to freak out here. 
[170]Regarding what? 
[171]No, but she's definitely pissed and hostile. And she's clearly starting to think that's something's not right. 
[172]I told her that I have no idea what Adam was talking about in that letter. 
[173]I have no idea. 
[174]Well I don't have that skill and if I had to guess I would say that in no way did she believe me. 
[175]Jesus Boyd you're going to O.D. him. 
[176]Nothing happened in Vegas. 
[177]Okay. Lois... here's the deal. Adam was with a prostitute in Las Vegas. 
[178]I'm sorry he was unfaithful to you. 
[179]I don't think that's such a good idea. 
[180]What are you going to do? 
[181]What does that mean? 
[182]I don't know... 
[183]I'm sorry. Honey... it's just for tonight. 
[184]Lois is a mess and Michael's really upset. Everyone's upset. 
[185]I know. 
[186]No one's discussing it. I'm just gonna run Michael home. I'll be right back. 
[187]Don't we already have someone to do that for us? 
[188]Okay. Okay. 
[189]Buzzing? 
[190]I don't hear it. 
[191]Have another drink. 
[192]The wahoo? 
[193]The wahoo moment? 
[194]I think so. 
[195]I appreciate it. I do, but... maybe you ought to just ease up on yourself a bit. 
[196]What is it? 
[197]Yeah. 
[198]What does that mean? 
[199]Yeah. 
[200]Hear what? 
[201]Now? 
[202]Isn't it a little late? 
[203]A move? 
[204]Greenpeace? 
[205]More? 
[206]What are you talking about? 
[207]That means we get five hundred thousand to help raise the kids. 
[208]Yes. 
[209]150 plus 350... we still get 500 thousand. 
[210]I'm just trying to help... 
[211]Stop kicking. Stop kicking! 
[212]No it's not okay. It's not. 
[213]Liz we've got to cancel, we have to put it off. 
[214]Do you love me? 
[215]Do you love me? 
[216]Oh God. We. Liz. We. We. Killed a woman. We... 
[217]Oh Liz. We. God. We, in Vegas. Michael crushed her skull. She was dead. There was nothing else to do. It was an accident. 
[218]The prostitute. 
[219]No Michael did. It was an accident. 
[220]Michael, by accident. 
[221]It's too late. 
[222]She's in the desert. She's out in the desert. 
[223]She's not alone... She's... Boyd... Oh God... He's gone nuts... He killed Lois and Michael... it's all... 
[224]But... 
[225]But... 
[226]I'm getting really tired of your bullshit. 
[227]You've got a warped thought process. Your brain doesn't function properly. 
[228]I'm talking about some bad, bad, very bad things. Bad things! Those are bad fucking things! 
[229]Fine? Fine what? 
[230]I'm serious. 
[231]What money? 
[232]You're sick. 
[233]Not a prayer. 
[234]You need help. 
[235]Downstairs in the closet. 
[236]What? 
[237]I do. 
[238]My God... 
[239]Did he try to kiss you? 
[240]He kept saying he was protected. 
[241]Like if something happened to him, he could still get us. 
[242]I don't know. He could have told someone. He could have, like in the event of his death, somehow let someone know where those bodies are buried. 
[243]So what do we do? 
[244]Move the bodies? 
[245]I... Liz... all I ever wanted, was for you to be happy. I just wanted to give you the wedding, the life you always dreamed of... ...I just love you so much... So much... 
[246]What? 
[247]No... 
[248]But... 
[249]Yeah. I'm thinking about Michael's Franco Harris fixation. You know how Michael was always harping "Immaculate Reception?" I've seen that play. A lot of times... and I have to say this... Franco was lucky. Flat out, right place, right time. That's it. He was where the ball bounced. You get me? 
[250]I'm saying it's luck. All luck. You work your entire life, all the training, focus, all the dedication, all irrelevant. Where does the ball bounce? My father spent his whole life trying to start a company, practiced every day, worked like a dog, finally got enough money. He's paid the dues, he's ready, does all the market research, picks his shot -- "Pup Corn." 
[251]That's right, "Pup Corn." Doggie treats. Little snacks for dogs. He's figured it out. There is a hole in the market and he's going to fill it. Spends all out money, works himself into not two but three heart attacks getting this shit up. After fifteen months, the big day arrives, the first box of "Pup Corn" pops off the belt. He comes running home with that box, pulls us out of school. We all pile into the living room, must be fifty of us, and in comes "Shelmer," our 8 year old mutt. "Here Shelmer," my dad cries. He's got that little fucking pup corn in his hand, "Here girl." This dog will eat anything, she eats rocks, anything. She walk's up to my dad's hand, looks down at the little pellet, licks it once, turns around, walks out of the room. Shelmer rejected the "Pup Corn." Fifteen months of my dad's life, right there. Not one dog ate Pup Corn. Not one. Three months later, "Pup Corn" shuts down. Chapter Eleven. My father never got over it. Never. 
[252]I think it was over here. 
[253]There. 
[254]There. This rock is where I stood when I said the prayer. 
[255]Bingo. 
[256]loads the cases into the car. 
[257]Yeah? 
[258]That's a good one. 
[259]I think you'd make an excellent Big Brother. 
[260]Yup. 
[261]Lost in his reverie, wakes up in a hair pin turn. The speedometer reads 80. They run out of road. The car skids on the shoulder, Fisher cranks the wheel, jumps the divider, into oncoming headlights. Fisher and Moore lit up bright... 
[262]Okay let's try it again. 
[263]Let's see the salutes! 
[264]It's okay, it's okay. 
[265]Timmy SHUT UP! Help your brother! ADAM! Let him help you! 
[266]Remember a scout is helpful! A scout doesn't scream in the face of adversity. 
[267]Okay, let's skip to the Scout's Oath... On my honor, I will do my best... ...to do my duty to God and my country... To obey the Scout Law, to help other people at all times... To keep myself physically strong, mentally awake, and morally straight.
dialogues.BOYD:
[1]David Boyd. Tina. Great. Okay. Here's the deal, we're talking five guys. Hard Rock. Nice guys Tina. My friends. Yeah. I'm calling you directly so you don't have to go through the agency... 
[2]Just stay off the property until I'm off the phone. 
[3]Cause that's the way they do it. 
[4]So it's five guys, Hard Rock Casino. Nine hundred bucks and you do the thing with the rubber hoses. Are you in? Tina, are you in? Good. 
[5]David Boyd, nice to meet you. 
[6]You're a fucking moron. 
[7]The hell I did! 
[8]The hell I did! 
[9]I never heard that. 
[10]Well, I didn't mean it. 
[11]Four hours and fifteen minutes. I can make Vegas in 3 and change. 
[12]Who's up for making some real money? 
[13]You want to hear me out? 
[14]Moore? 
[15]Fish? 
[16]Prison Communication Systems. An acquaintance friend of mine is professionally involved with a communications outfit in Denver that I just happen to know for a fact is about to be rewarded a very large, exclusive contract to rewire every state prison in Colorado. Yes sir. 
[17]That would translate to government guaranteed contract in excess of 35 million dollars. 
[18]Or a stock kick of approximately 125% on shares which are currently sitting around $4.38, or, in plain English... 
[19]What is wrong with you people? I'm a helper here. 
[20]That's the whole point. They rarely work out. But on occasion they do. And when they do, they do big. 
[21]Oh really? Starbucks? 
[22]One idea that if you had fucking listened to, you would each be worth approximately 15 million dollars. 
[23]I set up Fisher with the broker that found his house. Took care of that one, didn't I? Prison Communications. 
[24]Fine. Don't come crying to Boyd. No sir. 
[25]More. 
[26]But not tonight. 
[27]Jack Kerouback, Herman Melville, Henry Miller and Hunter S. Thompson. I dedicate this evening to fear and to major loathing. So from sun set to sun rise, let me be heard... 
[28]I don't hate women. 
[29]False. 
[30]Not true. 
[31]I am a lover. In Africa, you can stay king as long as you can service your women every night. 
[32]New king. 
[33]If I'm the king of Israel, I say to myself, King, I say to myself, King... Take a good look around. What do I see? 
[34]Then what do they have? 
[35]I say to myself, look at the map. Look what's all around you. People who wish bad bad things for you and your people. For thousands of years the Jews are fighting everybody. It used to be they'd throw rocks, then the iron revolution and they would attack with spears. Then the gunpowder revolution. Now they're shooting fire power back and forth, all day bullets flying, babies getting shot. 
[36]Now if I'm the King of Israel and all these sand niggers are armed to the gills and you know it's just a matter of time... right? Am I right? 
[37]There's my point exactly. 
[38]Take Mexico. 
[39]Look up the chickens, dig up the holy dirt, pack up the wailing crying wall thing they bang their heads on all day long, stick it all on a big fucking tug boat. The whole country picks up and takes Mexico. 
[40]The Mexicans would love it. They're dying for a little order down there. They need direction. 
[41]That's what I'm saying. Let the Israelis straighten it up. They got plenty of room down there, number one. Plus, and this is just a plus, they kind of look alike -- the Jews and the Mexicans. So I think on a whole your average Joe Mexican is gonna have less of a problem getting his head around the whole assimilation thing. Am I right? 
[42]Gentlemen, this is Tina. 
[43]She's all your's Fish. Anything you want. Happy bachelor party. 
[44]I'll take good care of you. 
[45]Tequila... 
[46]You don't know what you're doing. 
[47]Where do you look? What side of the neck? 
[48]Wait! 
[49]What are you doing? 
[50]What do you think you are doing? 
[51]Just wait a second. Wait one second. Okay. What are you doing? 
[52]Why? Why? She's dead. Why are you calling an ambulance? 
[53]Why? 
[54]No. 
[55]Shut up. 
[56]Shut up. 
[57]Everybody shut up. LISTEN TO ME! 
[58]Listen to me. Please. Everybody just calm down a bit here. Okay... First... are we sure she's dead? 
[59]Are you sure this was an accident? 
[60]Stop it! Listen to me. Let's just take a second here and take hold of the situation, OK? Let's just review our options here. 
[61]Call the police. Okay, that's one option. 
[62]Yes sir, there sure is an option here. There are always options. 
[63]Well we can definitely call the police. That's an easy call. If we call the police... What happens? They find a dead prostitute in the bathroom... They ask us... What happened? We say, ah... our friend, Michael... Your brother... got a little out of control... they were making love... and he got a little excited... and he, ah, sort of beat her head into the side of a toilet, while he choked her to death with a rubber hose... 
[64]There's more. 
[65]Just giving the facts. 
[66]What were we doing officer? Why didn't we help her? Well... we're all a bit high, you know, bachelor party, that kind of thing. Fisher here is getting married in three days... Beautiful wife... he didn't have anything at all to do with it... It was all Michael here... just Michael... 
[67]I've known him for while maybe twenty years kind of a close friend but hey what the heck officer, take him away, go on it's for his own good. 
[68]Bury her out in the desert. 
[69]We can take her out to Red Rock. Find some quiet place... and put her in the ground. 
[70]We can do this. We can get her out of here. 
[71]Nobody knows she's here. I called her personally. Nobody knows. 
[72]Nobody knows. 
[73]It's a marble floor, we can clean it up. 
[74]What's insane is the fact that Michael here put a fucking girl's head through a toilet. That's insane. 
[75]Her fucking head was caved in. 
[76]She's got bondage burns on her wrists. There's blow all over the room, Moore looks like he went at it with a mountain lion. This room looks like the Manson Family stayed here a month. Michael goes down, we all go down. 
[77]Lets take a vote. A simple vote. Two choices; we clean up the mess. Right now. Bury it in the desert, go home, and never look back. Or, we can call the police... Open those doors, roll the dice and hope that it's only Michael who falls. Let's take a vote. Desert... or police? 
[78]Desert. 
[79]Nobody knows she's here. 
[80]Wrap her up in blankets. Bring the car around to the back of the hotel, throw her off the balcony, put her in the car... Done. 
[81]We check out the area and wait for a time when it's clear. 
[82]Someone goes to Walmart, gets some buckets, brushes, mops, Spic and Span, the works. 
[83]The reality is, you take away the horror of this situation, take away the tragedy of the death, take away the moral and ethical implications of all the crap you have had conditioned, beaten, into your head since grade one. What are we left with? What? A 115 lb. problem. 115 lbs. that must be moved from point A to point B. Now, a straight line in the shortest distance but we are denied the luxury of a visible straight line. But that line exists and I see it. I see that line. Trust me. Adam. Trust me... I can take care of this. 
[84]What is it? 
[85]What? 
[86]She's not here. 
[87]She's here. She's just... Hold on a second. 
[88]Who? 
[89]Yup. 
[90]That's right. 
[91]She's in the bathroom... she's still working. 
[92]That's right. 
[93]Great. Fine. Perfect. 
[94]She's in there! 
[95]Help me! Don't let him bleed on the carpet! 
[96]He'll bleed out! He'll bleed dry. Help me hold the door. 
[97]All right people. New plan. Not even a new plan so much as a modification of the old plan. 
[98]So help me God you touch that phone and I bury you with them. Surrender is no longer an option. I repeat -- It is not an option. Is there anyone who does not understand that? 
[99]A little gut check time fellas. A time for some serious self- exploration. How do I function? For real? No more bullshit. Can I keep my cool when they bounce my bananas? When they won't play my fucking song? etc, etc. Do you get me? Do you get me? 
[100]Not a problem. Understand not my words, but follow my orders. Follow my orders 
[101]We will organize, we will mobilize, we will maximize and prioritize. 
[102]Let's do it people. 
[103]All right. Looking good people. 
[104]Sun rises at 5:52. 
[105]What? 
[106]We've already done this. 
[107]How do you figure? 
[108]So that's what we're doing. 
[109]She's Asian. They don't have Jews in Asia. 
[110]Well what the fuck are we supposed to do? 
[111]We have to get going. 
[112]Alright. Let's do it. 
[113]I got her arm. 
[114]Now I am the last to say that we have done here is a good thing. It's not. It's not a good thing. But it was, given the circumstances, the smart play. We did what had to be done. And... well... I'm proud of us. I'm proud of each and every one of us. We performed. Under the most complex and nerve shattering of situations, we stood fast and we delivered. I feel proud. 
[115]Wrong. That is flat out wrong. hell is for cowards, for hypocrites who fear to live by the strength of their own convictions. This is war. Given the circumstances and given the fact that we are alive and they are not, we have chosen life over death. Two wrongs don't make a right. So our conviction and execution would only mean more death here, not less. 
[116]That is a load of shit. Personal power has nothing to do with any of this. Tony Robbins has helped me to unlock energy and see my options more clearly, yes, but to give him credit for this, for all of this... Well that's just more than the man deserves. 
[117]What kind of words? 
[118]Go ahead. 
[119]Speak from the heart my brother. 
[120]No, this is the perfect time. This is real time. Adam. Your brother and I, as well as several others present, have always suspected that you... ...are a fully repressed, living in major denial, locked down, fly-boy butt-fucker. 
[121]Let's go! 
[122]The past is the past. Today is the beginning of the rest of our lives. 
[123]However it goes, the point is, nobody says anything to anyone ever. Right?... Right? 
[124]You're goddamn right. Adam? 
[125]Oh that's just nothing. That's just a missing persons thing, that's all. 
[126]No. I said nobody knew she was coming to the hotel. 
[127]What does that mean? 
[128]Oh I did? I think it was your little rat fuck brother who decided to play Hamburger Helper with the hooker's head. 
[129]Lighten up Adam. Show some character. 
[130]Watch the tone fella. 
[131]Any time fat boy! 
[132]Fisher had a less than normal relationship with that Donkey. 
[133]The problem was our quarterback had trouble remembering his right from left... 
[134]OK. Definitely not cool! Definitely inappropriate behavior here. 
[135]Negative. This is not what we have worked out in terms of presented behavior. 
[136]What is your problem? 
[137]What? 
[138]Who? What are you talking about? 
[139]Nobody's smoking anybody out. 
[140]You got some mighty fucking fine bad timing Adam. We got a rehearsal situation here. 
[141]Shut your fucking mouths!!! 
[142]Adam! Calm down. 
[143]It has worked. 
[144]They won't figure it out. 
[145]This is going to stop right now. Right now! 
[146]Why don't you just cool out. Go home and go to sleep. 
[147]Just go home, chill the fuck out. Okay? 
[148]Just go home. 
[149]All right. Let's all go back in. Adam? You're cool right? 
[150]It was just a crazy freak accident. He thought the car was in reverse... He didn't realize. 
[151]No. No. We were just all outside just talking. 
[152]The wedding. We were talking bout how it was going to be one of the last times for us to all be together with Fisher not being married... 
[153]Well I can't really comment on what "a lot of people" thought. I can only tell you that we had a horrible accident here and were all feeling extremely traumatized and your questions are a bit poorly timed. We're in full on grieving mode right now thank you very much Officer... Randone. 
[154]No easy Boyd! I got a best friend in there in pieces. How about a little sensitivity? 
[155]The need to know is clear. What did Adam tell Lois? That's the name of the game. What did Adam tell Lois? What does Lois know? 
[156]You want some breakfast meat, Michael. Is that what you want? 
[157]Easy Michael. 
[158]Okay. Time to fly. 
[159]You will get yourself together here mister. Are you hearing me? 
[160]He is not cracking up. 
[161]What did you ask me? 
[162]What is the question you asked me? 
[163]Yes, you did. Now that is the question! That is exactly the question we should be asking ourselves. You tell me Fisher. What have we done? 
[164]Say it again. 
[165]What you just said. Say it again. 
[166]Exactly! Exactly my point. 
[167]I'm not talking to you?

You are walking the walk. This is it Fisher, the real stuff. You love this woman. Love is second to nothing. I love you. I love Moore. I love Michael. [48]I guess. 
[49]Pup corn? 
[50]It was over by those rocks. 
[51]Where? 
[52]Got it. 
[53]in the hole, passing the suitcases up to Fisher. 
[54]I've been thinking about what you said that day. The prayer. About using this whole mess to bring out the good in me... 
[55]I think there's a lot of truth in that. I'm gonna pursue some options. I want to join that Big Brother thing. 
[56]I want a black one. A little black brother. That's a big problem it seems to me. Lack of racial integration. That's a big one. You think? 
[57]What do you think? 
[58]That's what I'm thinking. 
[59]Well that ought to be about the end of that.
dialogues.LOIS:
[1]Notice how clean and well-behaved they all appear, respectable members of modern society. Timmy, Adam Jr., take a good look at this... 
[2]...We will compare these before photos with whatever form of degeneration presented to us in 24 hours, no matter how low, how vile... 
[3]...regression of Modern Man to his most primitive, ape-like state... 
[4]The post-Vegas Man. 
[5]Okay boys, smile! 
[6]All right. As you were. 
[7]Group shot. Here we go boys! Yes sir, compare and contrast time! 
[8]Feeling a little HUNGOVER are we? Do you kids take note? See how pathetic Daddy and his jackass friends look?! 
[9]Don't snap at them! 
[10]They're singing. 
[11]Honey, go in there and get some Starbursts. 
[12]They're screaming for Starbursts. 
[13]They're screaming like monsters and it's giving me a headache. Go get some fucking Starbursts. 
[14]Where's the candy? 
[15]What do you mean? It's it's a goddamn Mini-Mart?! 
[16]Keith. It's Lois. I just found a note up in Adam's study. It's some kind of crazy confession about killing a stripper and cutting up bodies and... 
[17]I never liked you Boyd. You're a snaky little fuck. Always have been. 
[18]Don't sweet lip me. 
[19]You're a liar. I want to know what happened in Vegas. 
[20]I don't want to hear it from the liar. Stick a plug in it Boyd. Fisher? What happened in Vegas? 
[21]Moore? 
[22]Michael? Do you have something to tell me? 
[23]Shut up Boyd! Michael? 
[24]What? 
[25]I will call the police right now if I don't start getting some answers. 
[26]Fuck you Boyd. 
[27]What? 
[28]My Adam? 
[29]You picked the wrong woman mother- fucker!
dialogues.RALPH:
[1]Hello? Is anyone in there? 
[2]Ah, yeah, hi. Is Tina there? 
[3]I'm with Tina. Is she there? 
[4]Where is she? 
[5]Could you open the door please. 
[6]Okay. Hi. 
[7]So who's the lucky guy? 
[8]The groom? 
[9]Cool... You all dudes from L.A.? 
[10]Doing the bachelor party thing? 
[11]Sin City. Devil's Playground. The Black Bitch. All day every day. Where's Tina? 
[12]She's still working? 
[13]Sweet deal. 
[14]Is everything okay? 
[15]I'm gonna just tell her I'm waiting. 
[16]I'm just gonna let her know I'm here. 
[17]My God!
dialogues.JUDGE TOWER:
[1]We don't say "love, honor and obey" anymore. And we don't say "till death do us part." Today we say, "respect, honor and cherish, as long as you both do love." How does that sound? 
[2]All right then. It's refreshing to see two young people not afraid of real commitment. Will you have friends or family saying words -- singing or anything? 
[3]It's not a question of supposed to, it's an entirely personal decision... Some do some don't. 
[4]Okay great. What will that be? 
[5]What song? 
[6]Oh I know that. How does it go... 
[7]May we have the rings please? 
[8]The rings? 
[9]These rings represent the commitment Fisher and Liz make to each other on the day. Fisher do you take Liz to be your beloved wife, to respect, honor and cherish till death do you part? 
[10]Liz do you take Fisher to be your beloved husband, to respect, honor and cherish him till death do you part? 
[11]I now pronounce you husband and wife.
dialogues.ANNOUNCER:
[1]"The Oakland Raiders have taken a 7 - 6 lead in a, tough, football game and this crowd is standing..." 
[2]"Hang on to your hats, here come the Steelers out of the Huddle..." 
[3]"It comes down to one big play, 4th down, ten yards to go. Terry Bradshaw at the controls..." 
[4]"And Bradshaw, back and looking...Again, Bradshaw running out of the pocket... Looking for someone to throw to..." 
[5]...Bradshaw fires it down the field and there's a collision!..." 
[6]"...and it's caught out of the air! The ball is pulled in by Franco Harris!" 
[7]Franco Harris running for the end zone, all but home..." 
[8]And it's Franco Harris running for... 
[9]
dialogues.BARRY MORRIS:
[1]I don't see how this could have been kept from you. The facts are quite simple; last month Adam and Lois changed their will. They requested that you two, as a married couple, be the Custodians of Record for their estate including all properties, cash holdings, security holdings and... children. You are legal custodians of the Brenn Trust. 
[2]There's more. 
[3]Adam and Lois were not terribly prudent in terms of providing for the possibility of the unforeseen. 
[4]I'm talking about Life insurance. I'm talking about money. 
[5]Yes money. Adam had a five hundred thousand dollar Term Life Insurance Policy. 
[6]Actually, no. Adam was switching to a Whole Life Policy, but re-scheduled his medical exam... and failed to make his last payment... so his Term Life lapsed. So it's value is null and void. Now he did have a pension account, worth another 150 thousand. 
[7]And a house. Valued at 350 thousand. 
[8]No. Not even close. With property values down, the house is worth 100,000 less than 450 he paid for it. With three credit cards, the minivan payments, and other outstanding debts... Plus the Income and Estate Taxes assessed on his 
[9]So. When is the wedding.
dialogues.TINA:
[1]Who's the lucky groom? 
[2]Hi Fisher. 
[3]You said just dancing. 
[4]With him. Lucky me. 
[5]Oh come on. 
[6]It's gonna cost extra. 
[7]Easy baby, easy. 
[8]On the floor, legs twisted underneath her, lies growing in a growing puddle of dark blood. SILENCE as the guys stare, trying to comprehend.
dialogues.COP:
[1]Excuse me. 
[2]You okay? 
[3]Was there some sort of an argument? 
[4]We heard there was some arguing going on. Some loud talk. 
[5]What were you talking about? 
[6]A lot of people seem to think there was some hostility out there. 
[7]That's all I wanted to know.
dialogues.MAGGIE:
[1]Are you guys gonna fill this place with kids? You sure got room for them. 
[2]Take your time. I wish I had. 
[3]So where to on the honeymoon? 
[4]Smart. Smart. Smart. Think big picture, take your time. I wish I had. 
[5]Well, I just need your signature on these contracts and a deposit check so I can get the ball rolling. 
[6]Five percent should be fine for now, which is, let's see, twenty thousand dollars. Of course I'll be splitting my commission with your friend. He is a very sweet man.
dialogues.SUIT:
[1]How ya doing? 
[2]What's that? 
[3]I said how's it going? 
[4]Well that's what I said. 
[5]How do you like that mini-van? 
[6]The wife's begging me for one. How's the mileage.
